alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 20 at 10:24AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Yukon River between Tanana and the Nowitna River. * WHEN...Until 1215 PM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas along the Yukon River between Tanana and Nowitna River, and minor flooding of the lower Nowitna River. Flooding of low lying roads in Tanana is occuring and will continue this weekend. Water levels are expected to fall very slowly this weekend. Some areas of ponded water will see water remain for a number of days. Locations that have ice onshore will likely see that ice remain for days until it melts. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1010 AM AKDT, On Friday at 7pm, the ice jam downstream of Kallands began to move. This means that water levels along the Yukon from Tanana downstream to the Nowitna River, and along the lower Nowitna River are now slowly falling. Extensive flooding formed a large lake along and upstream of where the ice jam was with satellite imagery showing that flooding was occuring 20 to 30 miles up the Nowitna River, and along the Yukon River from the Nowitna River upstream to Kallands. Water is backed up all the way to Tanana, with minor flooding of low lying roads occuring in Tanana. Water will slowly drain back into the river, but water could remain in some low lying areas for many days. Ice that is onshore could remain for many days as well until it melts. - Minor flooding in Tanana of low lying roads in Tanana is expected to continue into the weekend. Water levels will fall slowly over the next several days at Tanana, but flooding is expected to remain in low lying areas through MOnday. Flooding is worse along the Yukon River near the Nowitna River and for 20 to 30 miles up the Nowitna River. Water levels in all those areas will fall very slowly over the next several days. Some poorly drained areas will keep water for many days. Ice that is up on shore will remain for many days until it melts. - For Tanana: At 9:00am the stage was 84.96 feet. Flood Stage is 86.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Yukon River between the Nowitna River and Tanana, or along the lower Nowitna River, stay take action to protect yourself from flooding.
info.instruction: People along the Yukon River between Tanana and the Nowitna River should prepare for high water. Move valuables away from the river to higher ground.
